news uk-news woman-teaches-incredible-cocker-spaniel-"Amazing dog learns to give CPRByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan |comments A woman has taught her dog how to perform CPR - being taught to jump on a dummyaposs chest and even check for its aposbreathingapos.Dog trainer Emily Anderson, , taught her cocker spaniel, Leo, the le-saving move for an international dog trick contest, which he has now won six times. Impressive footage shows Leo carrying a miniature first aid box in his mouth before laying it gently next to a prone mannequin. Emily then says aposnoseapos prompting the two-year-old to put his own head to the dummyaposs lips and check whether itaposs aposbreathingapos. Leo then jumps off his front paws and onto the dollaposs chest five times before going back to their nose and then repeating the routine a second time.Emily, from Aberdeen, said: Leo learnt CPR as part of a task called paw tricks for the International Trick Dog Competition. He has won the Champions League six times in a row.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. He jumps up and down when I say aposupapos and checks for the breathing when I say aposnoseapos. I taught him to check for breath using a target stick on the mouth of the dummy until he learnt where he needed to keep his nose. Leo weighs kg which is a bit too heavy to have him jumping on me. Every day he totally amazes me. Heaposs a real dog in a million, Iaposll never have another Leo. Leo constantly surprises Emily at how quickly he learns tricks, and even some she doesnapost even think are possible, he masters in just  minutes. Iaposve been training him ever since I brought him home at eight weeks, she said. I already had his half-sister Phoebe so I actually met him when he was three days old.  The footage of Leo performing the CPR has been viewed more than , times on social media and has received thousands of comments from people who were stunned by how clever he is. One person said: So clever. My spaniel would be running off with the first aid kit refusing to let go. Another wrote: That would definitely bring me round. Dogs are so much cleverer than us. A third commented: OMG. You training him to do this is nothing short of a miracle. Emily teaches Leo a new trick every week and builds them up methodically by making them slightly more dficult.  Emily said: For stacking the rings I started by teaching him to hold objects in his mouth, then dropping them into a washing basket. Gradually his target became smaller and eventually I got him to drop the rings onto the stack while I was holding it. It took about a month in total from start to end. Some of them are using similar skills but using them on dferent objects. Leo is so incredibly happy when heaposs training. Heaposll fall asleep watching TV afterwards but ends up waking himself up by wagging his tail so much. Phoebe will do tricks for treats but she isnapost as keen to do the brain games as much, she prefers weaving through targets. Emily ramped up Leoaposs training after he almost died in March  when he contracted a parasite called giardia. Emily said: I thought he was just sleeping under my desk one afternoon at work but when it came for me to leave, he just didnapost stand up. Leo had gone into shock so I rushed him into the emergency vet. They thought it was Lyme disease initially but a few days later it came back as giardia. The Mirror is committed to more hopeful news. We recognise the news agenda can sometimes feel overwhelmingly negative.And while itaposs our job to keep you informed and hold those in power to account, we are making a commitment to also report more hopeful news. We will celebrate the people, places and movements that are bringing good into the world and, more than that, we will dig beneath the surface of important issues with the aim of finding hope.We will be firm in our convictions - but always fair-minded. By sharing solutions to problems, we can do more good and feel better about the world around us. Because we believe you deserve it. #mirrormorehopefulFollow on Twitter @mirrormorehope And follow Mirror More Hopeful on Facebook It shouldnapost make dogs that ill but Leo had taken it badly and it sent him into shock. It was a horrible few days. Incredibly he recovered physically after only a few days but it really affected him mentally and made him very anxious. We started to get back to normal and then we went into lockdown. So from nowhere, we were at home all of the time and he was just really sad. He wasnapost like the happy dog he was before and I knew I had to do something to help him out of his slump. I knew heaposd always enjoyed his training so I decided to focus on doing a bit more of that with him and thataposs how the tricks started.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. news us-news grieving-mum-surprised-teddy-bear-"Mother reacts to teddy bear with husband’s voice who passed awayByKatie L WilsonAlyce Collins:,  Jan |commentsA grieving mum has been surprised with a teddy bear which has her late husband’s voice inside. Kris Tierney was bought the gt by her daughter Jamie Nowacki, , a teacher from Ohio, to mark her first anniversary without late husband Tim. Tim would always give his we flowers, so Jamie also followed suit and took a bouquet to her house to mark their th wedding anniversary. She gave her a teddy bear which has a sound box placed inside, so that when pressed it plays an audio recording of Tim saying, love you. The audio recording is from a voicemail which they cut down to use as a shorter soundbite. Kris couldn’t believe it when she heard her late husband’s voice once again, and said she will cherish the bear for a long time. Jamie said: “It was my parentsapos wedding anniversary and the first without my dad, so I knew I needed to find something very special to give her. “My dad always gave my mom flowers so I knew we had to take some over to her. He passed away unexpectedly from a fall. “What made the bear even more special was that my mum always called him her Timmy Bear and he signed every letter and card he gave her with aposTimmy Bear’, thataposs why I knew it had to be a bear. It started way back before they even got married.  “She didn’t realise what the bear did until we told her to push its paw. Once she heard his voice she lost it. “I knew it was just what she needed to hear, his voice saying ‘love you’. It made her day, even though it was such a hard day. “It was a dficult day for her and she said that she felt happy, sad and thankful all at once.” Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON LoveMarriageBears" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: parents whose two children niece
story: Parents whose two children and niece drowned after they drove into floodwater avoid jailDaniel and Lacey Rawlings were given  months of supervised probation without jail time in their sentencing on Thursday,Daniel and Lacey RawlingsByMirror:,  Jan |commentsA couple whose two children and niece drowned when the family car drove into a flooded creek in  have escaped jail time. Daniel and Lacey Rawlings were given  months of supervised probation without jail time in their sentencing on Thursday. In a Colorado court, Judge Timothy Wright sentenced Daniel to  months of probation and , hours of community service, while Lacey received  months of supervised probation and  hours of community service.The horror incident happened on November  of , after a period of heavy rain in the area north of Phoenix,People reported.The Bar X Crossing at Tonto Creek had flooded and authorities had placed a barricade to turn vehicles away from the area. Daniel was driving the military-style vehicle, with seven children in the back.  Authorities alleged that he drove the vehicle around the barricade and through the creek - a journey he had made several times earlier that day. However, this time the vehicle was swept up in the rushing water. The parents and four of the children were rescued by helicopter, but the three other children did not survive. The bodies of the coupleaposs -year-old son, Colby, and the boyaposs cousin, -year-old Austin, were recovered the following morning, while the body of Colby’s sister, -year-old Willa, was found two weeks later on the edge of the lake, several miles away. Both Daniel and Lacey were each initially charged with seven counts of child abuse.  Daniel, who was behind the wheel of the vehicle, was also charged with three counts of involuntary manslaughter. In December, Daniel entered a guilty plea to three counts of manslaughter and seven counts of child abuse. Meanwhile, Lacey pleaded guilty to one count of child abuse. Speaking in court on Thursday afternoon, Lacey described the incident as a “mistake [she agonizes] over every minute”.  “I will continue to agonize over it for the rest of my le, she said. Iaposm so sorry. Lacey went on to describe her surviving children as being her “world”. My kids are the reason I get out of bed every single day. My kids are the reason I found a way to move on. They deserve a happy le. They deserve a mother who tries her absolute hardest to give them everything they need. Daniel took the stand next to read a prepared statement.  I wish every day that I could go back and relive and redo the events of that horric day, he said. I wish I could take that trauma and carry it myself. I wish I could take everybodyaposs pain and bottle it up and hold it myself because nobody deserves to endure pain that I have caused them. While many family members spoke on the couple’s behalf, at least one relative urged the judge not to be too lenient. Austin’s grandmother, Lynn Morey, told the judge she still has nightmares about the incident. Cutting corners when it comes to childrenaposs safety is a deal-breaker,” she said. Thanksgiving has never been the same since. That feeling of dread lingers throughout the weekend, overshadowing everything our family does, despite our attempts to live through this, be grateful and move on. The coupleaposs probation begins immediately. news weird-news cleaning-fanatics-obsessed-p-washing-"TikTok user shares dish soap hackByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan |comments Sometimes it feels like you can only wear a white piece of clothing once, before it gets stained and its colour dulls after just one spin in the washing machine. No matter how hard you try, those whites always end up looking grey. However, one TikTok trend doing the rounds on social media promises to have your whites looking bright, and the best bit is, itaposll only set you back a few pence. The hack was shared by one user, @burcibaci, who revealed the one simple and cheap item you need to add to your wash to ensure those whites stay white - washing up liquid.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. All you need to do is add a small amount of washing up liquid to a small cap, before throwing it in the washer with your white load, although the TikToker recommends you do this in addition to your washing detergent, rather than in its place. aposaposI would also add your detergent too for the best clean, she wrote alongside the clip, which has since been viewed more than , times. Although she used a pale coloured Fairy Liquid, other TikTok users recommended blue soaps as they can be used to cancel out the yellow tones in the white materials. Many people questioned how the bubbles from the soap didnapost overflow, but @burcibaci simply explained that you only have to use a very small amount for it to be effective. It also makes a great stain remover! One part dawn dish soap, one part hydrogen peroxide, one helpful TikToker commented. news weird-news i-catfished-boss-made-up-"TikTok user was catfished by her boss at workByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Jan |commentsThereaposs always a risk with modern dating that the person youaposre talking to, via an app or text, could end up being a catfish.Andweaposve learned anything from the MTV show Catfish, itaposs that sometimes the person is actually someone you know and would least expect - pretending to be a potential match. One woman has gone viral online after sharing the jaw-dropping tale of how she was catfished by her manager at work, of all people. Olivia Fenton, an actor from New York City, claimed in a video on TikTok @oliviafentonthat her manager had tried to set her up with her best guy friend. Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here. She gave her aposhisapos number and the pair began texting and arranged a date - only for Olivia to be stood up.And when they planned a second date, she was stood up again as he claimed he was stuck in meetings. A third date was planned and the guy said he came to the bar, didnapost see Olivia and left - then tried to come back to find her and his train got stuck underground. At this point, Olivia had enough and told her manager she didnapost think things were going to work out between her and the male friend.  A few months later at Christmas, the mysterious guy sent her a text again asking for one more chance and having nothing better to do Olivia agreed. However, she was once again stood up at dinner as this time the guy claimed heaposd been in a car accident. Bewildered, Olivia finally started to connect the dots. Did you also start putting the pieces together, like maybe it was your manager the whole time and maybe you found out she had a burner phone and used some random gayaposs photos who lives in Georgia, she explains. She also sent flowers to your house pretending they were from the guy and when you fact-checked the handwriting on the note with the flowers, her handwriting and his handwriting were exactly the same.  In a follow-up video, Olivia adds that she reported the incident to HR and her boss was fired. She also found out this wasnapost the first time the manager had done something like this, sheaposd also done the same thing to a woman at a previous company sheaposd worked at. Olivia believes her manager had been struggling with her sexuality and might have had a crush on her. Thousands of people commented on TikTok, with many stunned by the story. One person wrote: What the F**K. Another said: Sprinting to HR. A third asked: What in the letime move is this ! Someone  added: NO STOP. I was not expecting the twist.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: i regret childrens boring names
story: I regret my children’s boring names – I should have been more adventurousYouTuber Sarah-Jayne Strum, known as SJ, admitted she has regrets the ‘safe’ names she gave her children and that she wishes she had been ‘braver’ when choosing themSarah-Jayne Strum spoke honestly about her choices Image: YoutubeByLizzie McAllisterNewsletter Lead, Nationals:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan |commentsYoutuber and mum-of-three Sarah-Jayne Strum took to her channel to admit that she regrets the names she picked for her three children. Speaking honestly to her subscribers, she admitted ‘people-pleasing’ when it came to choosing what to call her two sons and daughter. She eventually chose Frederick David for her first son, Finn Barnaby Boo for her middle child and Evelina Blossom for her youngest. I always loved floral names, she said. My husband hated all flower names, he wanted a stronger, more classic girl name and that they are not to be taken seriously. I really disagree and feel I should have been a bit firmer. Sarah-Jayne, known as SJ to fans, said her other choices for Evelina had been Marlowe, Florence, Juniper and Bronte.  What do you think of the names  Have your say in the comment section below.She continued: We wanted to be a bit safe in our choices and that’s something that I regret, I think I went way too safe, I think I just went too middle road and I should have pushed the boat out a lot more. She also admitted that there had been a particular boysapos name that sheaposd always loved. SJ explained: The number one name I really regret because I didn’t give it enough of a chance was the name Atticus. It’s a people pleaser thing when you pick names because you worry about what other people will think of it. If I went back I think I would be a lot braver because I definitely regret not sticking to my convictions and listening to other people. Don’t pick the one you think everyone  is going to like - pick the one you think is a bit more unique and special and you will love. This isnapost the first time the mum-of-three has made headlines. In , SJ made the news after she broadcast her labour of Eveline to , people online. She currently boasts K subscribers on her popular YouTube channel, where she posts content about parenthood. In a video welcoming newcomers to the channel, the influencer says: I started YouTube because motherhood and parenting is literally the best thing Iaposve ever been lucky enough to do. I wanted to capture it. I wanted to literally capture every single second I could. I know for an absolute fact that one day when Iaposm older, Iaposll sit and watch hours and hours of these videos and Iaposll definitely cry, Iaposll hopefully laugh, and I know Iaposll just wish to go back to their childhood just for one single day, and I hope through this that I kind of can.Did you pick an unique name for your little one  Email yourmirror@trinitymirror.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON PregnancyParenting" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man devours 12lb chicken tikka
story: Man devours lb of chicken tikka in just  minutes - containing , caloriesYouTuber Max Stanford took on the epic challenge, which saw him eat a curry  times bigger than a normal mealYouTuber Max took on the epic food challenge earlier this week Image: @MaxVsFood_ Mercury PressByLizzie McAllisterNewsletter Lead, Nationals:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan |commentsA YouTuber and charity worker took on an immense challenge for his .K subscribers - eating an enormous portion of chicken tikka masala. The curry challenge contained six jars of tikka masala sauce, rice, and a hefty portion of chicken, with the dish weighing in at .lb and racking up an eye-watering  calories. Max Stanford, , managed to devour the meal in just  minutes and  seconds. Max, from South London, said: “lbs of chicken tikka masala was never going to go down easily, so my huge spoon really helped to mix everything together. “After ten minutes, I’d made a pretty big dent in the curry and was about halfway through. “The initial taste was amazing, and it bought back a lot of childhood memories as it was a dish my mum, Fiona, , would make often.” Do you think you could complete the challenge  Email yourmirror@trinitymirror.Max took on the challenge at the new year after being challenged by one of his favourite professional eaters and  Hooters wing champion, Geoff Esper. He said: I’ve always been a big fan of Geoff, so was super excited to do a collaboration with him, where he challenged me to eat a huge bowl of tikka masala. “He wanted to make it dficult for me, so set the weight at lbs, which is about  times your average curry dish.” Not only did Max conquer the immense challenge, but he even managed to enjoy a side of teacake. He adds: “The flavour fatigue did set in after a while, which is why I ate a teacake in between to mix the flavour up. “Finishing the curry was definitely the best part. “I’ve never eaten that much of one thing so quickly before, so I was pleased at the professional level of eating I managed. “I definitely would have struggledthe curry was hotter, as it would have been quite hard to eat all of that spice. “I’m really glad Geoff put me up to the challenge, and I’d love to copy some of the challenges that he’s done in the future, like eating  pop-tarts within  minutes.” This is not Maxaposs first food challenge - two weeks ago he took on an epic , calorie eating challenge with girlfriend Laura, in which they pitted US and UK snacks against each other. In order to keep his physique in spite of the insane food challenges he takes on Max combines daily cardio training at the gym as well as eating salads and healthy alternatives on non-challenge days.You can watch Max’s latest challenge here. title: man skips 9am work meetings
story: Man skips am work meetings after finding flaw in contract - and boss cant sack himAn independent contractor has caused a stir online after sharing a look at the entertaining conversation they had with a manager about his failure to attend morning meetingsHe got in trouble for not attending the morning meetingsImage: Getty ImagesByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Jan |commentsIf thereaposs one mistake many people make in their work-le, itaposs failing to read their contracts closely enough - and this applies to both bosses and employees. One man has shown just how much of a dference it can make, knowing your contracted responsibilities.A Twitter user named Caleb, who posts under @birdrespecter has gone viral after sharing a text exchange he had with middle management on a project he was working as an independent contractor on.The messages revolve around Caleb not attending a am morning meeting and a manager insisting he must join every day. Caleb cleverly points out this is not mentioned in his contract - and things escalate from there.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.The initial text reads: Hi Caleb, I was just informed you werenapost on the morning stand up call this morning  How come  To which Caleb replies: Yeah dude I was asleep. I basically never join those. The manager comes back with: Going forward meetings are a requirement for employment at [company name]. I expect you to be on the next call tomorrow at AM EST. Caleb responds: Man that sucks for you guys, but Iaposm not an employee. My contract says nothing about required hours or daily meetings.  The manager is unimpressed with this and tries to threaten Calebaposs job, sending: You REALLY need an attitude adjustment! If you arenapost on the next call, youaposre fired. Your choice.Calebaposs response is very chilled, adding: You can fire meyou want, but you guys have to pay me through the th of next month regardless, so Iaposm definitely sleeping in tomorrow. Enjoy your meeting.You guys really ought to read the contracts you have us sign sometime. Pretty wild stuff in there. Following this the manager asks Caleb to please call him, to which he gets a swt and simple no. More than , people liked the screenshots of the messages on Twitter, with over , retweeting and thousands replying. Caleb later updated to clary that he hadnapost been fired as the man had no authority to do that. He said: For context,anyone cares, this person doesnapost work at the agency that handled my contract. They donapost even run the department I was working in and have no authority to fire me. Just a middle management nerd trying to be a cop. A final update revealed that the company had determined the man had no authority to fire him and they required him toto work as scheduled to finish the site installation before they would mutually walk away from this. But Caleb wasnapost having any of it and so he quit, adding: Incredible. I was just about to call and tell him Iaposd finish, then I saw this. According to them my contract actually was terminated. So in regards to finishing, absolutely not. Your department is a mess and your employees have no idea what theyaposre doing. I have no interest in discussing this further. Donapost text me again. People on Twitter praised Caleb for his responses, with one calling the conversation genuinely beautul Another said: This is genius! Good for you. Someone  added: This is a god-tier response.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news mcdonalds-worker-shares-what-hollow-"McDonalds worker shows what spoon in McFlurry is actually forByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan |comments If youaposve ever ordered a McFlurry from McDonaldaposs, the chances are youaposll have been left disappointed when trying to suck up the last of your ice cream - only to discover the hollow end of the spoon is not actually a straw.For years fast-food lovers have been convinced the plastic spoons were actually a design defect, becauseyou canapost use them as a straw then why on Earth are they made that shape  Well, it turns out thereaposs actually a perfectly logical explanation for it, and it has nothing to do with straws at all.A resurfaced TikTok, which originally went viral a couple of years ago, has revealed the true purpose behind the square spoons and itaposs actually designed for McDonaldaposs staff.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here.The video, posted to the @foodies TikTok account, shows that the end of the spoon is designed to attached to the end of a mechanical whisk, which can then be used to mix up your McFlurry before itaposs served to you. Who knew If you didnapost know, now you do, they wrote. We do indeed, and judging by the comments, it seems like everyone is just as baffled as us. My le is complete so now I may die in peace, one TikTok user joked, while another added: Omg what my McDonald’s doesn’t mix the McFlurry! Wow! You just solved one of my entire le mysteries, a third wrote, while a fourth replied: Well that explains it after all these years. title: mortgage expert bewildered woman blows
story: Mortgage expert bewildered as woman blows £, deposit money on psychic readingA mortgage expert has recalled the most bizarre issue shes ever had with a client, when a woman sent over her bank statements ahead of the sale going through - but all her money was goneJordans video went viral Image: @anutterhomeloan TIKTOKByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Jan |comments A home loan advisor has gone viral online after sharing the aposcraziestapos thing sheaposs ever seen on a clientaposs bank statements. In a clip posted on TikTok, Jordan Nutter from the US, who posts under @anutterhomeloan, re-enacted a phone conversation she had with a client who was about to close on a property.The client had sent through bank statements for proof of deposit, the week before sheaposd had ,in her bank. However, when Jordan got the latest statement through, there was just , left in the account. Baffled as to where the money had all gone, Jordan called the client to find out what was going on. Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.In the clip, she says: I got your bank statements you sent last night, I donapost understand what happened... all of the money is gone. I see all of these withdrawals and I donapost know what it is. Jordanaposs jaw then drops as the woman on the other end of the phone tells her she spent the money on a psychic. You called a psychic  We were supposed to have , in this account at least because thataposs what we needed and thereaposs , left, so how did we do this  Weaposre closing in a week so I donapost understand.  The woman on the phone goes on to explain that she called the psychic to seethe house was going to close. Jordan continues: But now all the moneyaposs gone  So have you talked to her about that, how itaposs going to come back  She said itaposs just going to happen  She has no idea where this money is coming from, that youaposre going to magically get in the next couple of days, that you spent on her to tell you that the house was going to close  Iaposm going to be honest with you, weaposre probably not going to close. We donapost have any money... you spent it all on her. More than one million people have since watched the clip, with thousands liking it. One person replied: Wait, so she really spent , on a psychic ! Jordan replied: It was bad, really bad. This makes me feel better about my le choices, said someone . A third wrote: Okay so my  impulse purchase on make-up from Sephora really isnapost that bad. But the psychic told me it will be fine, you are wrong, joked someone .Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: mum branded selfish friends backing
story: Mum branded selfish by friends for backing out of £ hen doThe mum-of-two said she was made to feel guilty when she realised she couldnt afford the lavish do in LiverpoolThe extravagant weekend was set to take place in June Image: GettyByLizzie McAllisterNewsletter Lead, NationalsJess Flaherty:,  Jan |commentsA woman has been branded selfish after backing out of a hen do costing £ a head. The mum-of-two had originally agreed to attend the event, which was set to take place in June, but the bride has since decided to have a destination wedding in Spain. The price of the trip, including travel and children, has meant sheaposs unable to afford the Liverpool hen do.The the bridesmaid organising the celebration and several other attendees were angry with the mum as they would have to absorb her costs, reports Liverpool Echo. The woman took to Mumsnetaposs popular Am I Being Unreasonable [AIBU] forum for advice - but tricked users in a bid to get honest answers.Posting a reverse, she told the story from the perspective of the bridesmaid who was tasked with arranging the getaway. Iaposm organising a hen do for later in the year for my friend who Iaposm bridesmaid for. She is getting married in Spain, she wrote.  Iaposve booked a hen do in Liverpool for  weeks before the wedding which is costing £ each and we were all paying for the bride within that cost. One of my friends who was attending the hen and the wedding has text[ed] over the weekend saying she canapost afford to do both and is therefore pulling out of the hen do so she can still go to the wedding. The thing is she had told us she was coming so now it means that we are short for the activities we had planned and either have to now do less than we have told everyone, or ask the bride to pay for herself. She said we can keep the £ deposit she paid. AIBU [am I being unreasonable] to think that sheaposs being a bit selfish, as she already committed to coming  Hundreds of users weighed in, with % of them voting it was unreasonable for the bridesmaid to call the mum selfish for pulling out. She then revealed she was actually the friend who has cancelled and that her posed had been a aposreverseapos. Justying the move, she added: Confession... this is a reverse. I didnapost want to pull the aposwoe is meapos card and have people vote in sympathy. Everything  is totally true. Have you had a wedding drama  Email yourmirror@trinitymirror.I knew the cost at the start, they were very honest and I felt that it was a lot but still agreed and instantly regretted it. I didnapost know at the time that flights to Spain would cost as much as they have, plus I have  young dc [dear children] and when we go to the wedding we are having to put them in a holiday club at the cost of £ a day between them as family who have them for the  days in August that fall on working days work full time. I canapost afford it but have been made to feel so guilty these last  days by the bridesmaid and others going, I feel like the s****est friend in the world. Iaposve not spoken to the bride yet as she knows nothing and I donapost want to drop anyone in, it or upset her. What a mess. Fellow Mumsnet users rushed to support the woman, with one commenting: I canapost abide this extravaganza that weddings have become. Itaposs about the marriage! Another added: If theyaposre so keen to have you there, OP, they can stump up the cash for it! Maybe bride can pay for herself and reduce the cost for everyone ! Responding to the comments, the mum said: Thanks. Sorry for the reverse as well... I know theyaposre flipping annoying... But as I was writing my OP [original post] out it felt very much like I was trying to sway the vote with pity. Itaposs no excuse though.Do you think she was right or wrong  Have your say in the comment section below.Something has happened financially to us this past  weeks which is why my circumstances have changed so much. A few of the group do know about this Iaposve not hidden it, but itaposs meant the hen do which felt very expensive before is just no longer affordable unless I take out a credit card and thataposs something I really want to avoid, or by the time I get back Iaposll be paying it off in the run up to Xmas which means it will just be ongoing. I have huge anxiety over being the most hated guest at the abroad wedding now. title: my pal told return gifts
story: My pal told me togts I bought her baby - the colour didnt suit herA woman took to Mumsnet to ask whether she was in the wrong to feel hurt that her friend asked her toa gt she bought for her baby - but the majority of users were on her side Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan |commentsA woman was left stunned after her friend told her tothe baby gts she got her because they didnapost suit the newborn. The anonymous woman explained that she gted her friend who had just had a baby some clothes.It was like a T-shirt and joggers set thing that I got in a small independent shop, she said in her post to Mumsnet.One of the items was a really pale pink and the other was a light yellow. But her friend was less than impressed with the clothes and was quick to text her to tell her so. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Instead of thanking her for the thoughtful gt, which the woman admitted was not cheap, her pal told her the colours werenapost right and askedshe couldit. The woman was stunned and said she aposwould never have dreamed of making such a commentapos. I had some really unusual colours but I smiled, said thank you and the kids wore them as I was grateful to receive gts, she said. Sheaposs concluded her post by asking users where she has a right to feel offended. The majority of Mumsnet users were horried by the womanaposs rude reaction and a few others shared how they would respond to the text. aposNo problemyouthem I’ll get them refunded,apos suggested one person. Another added: She’s not a friend! Sorry, she was so rude to you but I think you’ve learnt your lesson now. I got a few sets of baby clothes that weren’t to my taste, added a third. I wouldn’t have dreamed of saying anything other than thank you. And they still got worn given that a small baby doesn’t really have an opinion on these things. title: three bed house goes sale
story: Three-bed house goes on sale for same price as second-hand car - with a gardenThe three-bed property is due to go under the hammer next month and costs the same as a luxury handbagThe house is the same price as a second-hand car Image: North News  Pictures Ltd northnewsByLizzie McAllisterNewsletter Lead, Nationals:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan |commentsA family home is due to go up for sale for a mere £, - the same price as a second-hand car or luxury handbag. The three-bed property in Middlesbrough is set to go under the hammer next month. The tiny price tag could also fetch you a Prada Ostrich leather bag or a pre-owned Ford Fiesta, which sell for around the same amount. The property, which is located on Finsbury Street in the Northeast town, boasts three spacious double bedrooms and a bath and shower room. It also features a family-sized living room, and a kitchen leading out onto the garden. One of the bedrooms even has space for an office desk in the corner as well as a double wardrobe, making working from home a real possibility for potential homeowners. With nearby Middlesbrough, Thornaby, and Marton railway lines all within three miles of the property, the house is well-connected to transport links.Fancy living here  Have your say in the comment section below.  But the residential area is also ideal for beach walks, with Finsbury Street roughly a -minute drive to the nearby coastline. Royal Estates, the company that manages the property, describes it as: A three bedroom terraced house located in a quiet residential area. The property briefly compromises of: entrance hallway, through lounge, kitchen leading into rear garden, three bedrooms, family bathroom and a turfed rear garden. The impossibly small price tag pales in comparison to average UK house prices, and is much more affordable than other homes in the area. The average price of terraced houses sold in Middlesbrough last year was £,, while houses on the same street came in at an average of £,. A house in London, however, would set you back an average of £K, according to Zoopla, while the national norm is £K. news weird-news woman-shares-trick-drying-clothes-"Tiktoker reveals hack to dry clothes in only two hoursByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan |commentsA woman has shared a simple hack for drying wet clothes in just two hours without a tumble dryer. Alix Byrne, who lives in a one-bedroom apartment with her partner Andrew, was struggling like many of us to keep on top of her laundry. Despite having numerous clothes airers, she couldnapost find space to hang all of her clothes to dry. But one day while she was putting her bedding out to dry, the -year-old had a eureka moment. As she covered the clothes horse with the bedsheet, placing it near the radiator, she found that the sheet had created a pocket of hot air, drying the clothes underneath within just two hours. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. It was kind of a eureka moment,” Alix, a postwoman, said. I was trying to find where  to hang the bed sheet to dry, apart from over the kitchen door which ends up smelling of whatever you’re cooking. I usually keep my clothes frame by the radiator, especially in winter and I just thought aposwhy not throw the bedsheet over the frame, tuck the ends behind the radiator and under the stands then the hot air from the radiator will dry my clothes in hours.apos I stay in a small, cosy, one bed flat with my partner and we always have two clothes frames at once as we have busy lestyles and go through a lot of washings which takes up too much space.  We have a tumble dryer but to be honest, it costs far too much and doesn’t really leave your clothes smelling the best. I think the reason this hack would benefit people is it saves money on tumble drying. You probably have the heating on anyway as it’s January. It saves up space as your clothes would be dry within hours and the clothes horse can be packed away again and into the cupboard. Instead of the usual  hours and your clothes are still damp – then low and behold, it’s time for another washing! It doesn’t have to be a never-ending cycle anymore.Alix shared the incredible results on Facebook, where her post racked up more than , likes.Thousands of users took to the comments section to share their own experiences and tips. One person said: Done this for years it’s actually brilliant all my clothes dry so quick! Another wrote: Definitely giving this a go, takes about three days to dry an airer full of washing. A third commented: Well this looks like a bloody game changer! Someone  said: “Omg why haven’t I saw this before, constantly wondering how to dry washing faster with all radiators being full, dryer full and clothes horse full. [sic] Alix also shared a few top tips to maximise results. She said: People askdampness occurs, but I use a double bed sheet over a king sheet so it’s not totally covering the whole clothes frame and there’s still gaps for the air to escape and heat the room up – win win! If you’re worried about damp, crack a window slightly or have a dehumidier nearby. People have also askedthis can cause fires but I don’t think a radiator is hot enough,you’re that worried just turn it down on a low heat for longer and keep an eye on it. I’ve found on a medium-high setting, they were dry within - hours and - on low give or take. My clothes also still smell fresh of the fabric conditioner because they dried so quick.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: woman transforms kitchen 230 just
story: Woman transforms kitchen for £ in just five days using BQ bargainsInstead of spending a fortune bringing in the professionals, Zuzana decided to take on the job of redecorating her kitchen by herself using supplies she purchased from BQ, Etsy and eBayZuzana in her new kitchen Image: latestdealsByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan |commentsA woman has revealed how she transformed her kitchen in just five days spending only £. Zuzana James, , a flight attendant from Bedford, wanted to give her kitchen some much needed TLC. But knowing that her friends had been quoted £, to have professionals fit their kitchen, which is a similar size to hers, she decided to attempt to do the work herself. In just five days while in self-isolation, she spent £ on supplies from BQ, eBay and Etsy, turning her dreams of having a Pinterest-perfect cream shaker kitchen into a reality.Zuzana told LatestDeals : The idea was in my head for a while.I always look for ways to improve our home and follow a lot of home accounts on social media. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. I saw other people completely transforming their kitchens with a lick of paint, but I never really had the time to give it a go. Then I tested positive for Covid just after New Year and had no symptoms, so I took my self-isolation as the perfect opportunity to crack on.” Zuzana used bargains from BQ, eBay and Etsy to complete her kitchen transformation. She continued: I got everything I needed from BQother than the door handles. I used click and collect and sent my husband to collect as I obviously couldn’t leave the house. I spent about £ on the supplies, which included primer, cabinet paint, topcoat, frog tape, sugar soap, a couple of sanding blocks and some brushes and foam rollers. I started by scrubbing all the surfaces with sugar soap to get rid of any dirt and grease. I then took the doors off the hinges and took the handles off. All the cabinets got a light sanding with a sanding block before I started with the primer. For priming I used the Bullseye primer and did two coats, lightly sanding in between coats.  Then I used V cabinet paint in Soft Grey and also did two coats. I then finished off with two coats of sheer satin topcoat.” Believe it or not, the kitchen handles were the biggest cost for Zuzana. She explained: The handles ended up being the biggest cost of this transformation. I tried to do it cheaply and ordered cup handles and knobs from Amazon, but ended up sending them straight back because they were super flimsy and cheap looking. You do get what you pay for!So I had to bite the bullet and spend £ on door handles. The cup ones are from eBay and the knobs are from Etsy. But they just make such a dference!For the tiles, I just used the same primer, some white tile paint I already had at home and the same topcoat.  Instead of getting a whole new worktop, Zuzana decided to wrap it using DC Fix Oak Effect, also from BQ. She purchased three rolls, which were £ each. She added: I used the leftover wrap to wrap a couple of shelves and created a display cabinet for my little Starbucks mug collection. Wrapping the worktop was the trickiest job, so I’d recommend getting a second person to help hold it all in place. But it is doable - I managed on my own. This brought the complete cost to about £ - and it was worth every penny!” Zuzana has some advice for people who are looking to transform their space but aren’t sure where to start. She said: The advice I would give people is to go for it - but onlyyou have at least four or five days of time on your hands, as it’s not a job for one afternoon. Personally it took me five days to do everything, but it obviously depends on the size of the kitchen and how many hours you put in each day.  The feeling after it was all done was just priceless though!” Zuzana is thrilled with the savings she has made and is seriously impressed with how her new kitchen looks. She added: The response I had after posting this on my social media was also overwhelming and few people suggested I start a home page myself.So I’m giving it a go on Instagram @living_on_lovelland I’ll be sharing a step by step of how I did everything.It looks even better than I imagined and it gives me a surge of pure happiness and feeling of accomplishment every time I walk into the kitchen, which is all the time now! Our friends are having a new kitchen done which is a similar size to ours and they got quoted £,, sowe would have got it professionally changed, I’m guessing it would cost somewhere in that region. I feel pretty smug knowing how much we’ve saved, and since I haven’t got thousands to spend, it was the only way I could have a nicer kitchen! Tom Church, co-founder of LatestDeals, says: Shaker kitchens are all the rage at the moment, but they can cost a fortune to install new - as Zuzana says, quotes can be £k and even more. But Zuzana has proved that we can all get the look for less by doing it ourselves! Her kitchen looks truly sensational, so much so that it’s hard to believe it cost just £! Using DC Fix, painting supplies and investing in some gorgeous handles, Zuzana has given us all a masterclass in bringing Pinterest-worthy spaces to our homes for a seriously wallet-friendly price.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: china unveils new space rocket
story: China unveils new space rocket with wings for suborbital tourism by Space Transportation aims at transporting passengers across the world at speeds of ,mph, by flying into the orbit and back down to EarthA Chinese firm is developing a new machine to transport tourists into space and across the world Image: Space TransportationByAntony Thrower:,  Jan |commentsA Chinese firm is developing a new machine to transport tourists into space and across the world at speeds of ,mph, dubbing it a rocket with wings. A video by Space Transportation shows animated passengers boarding a plane attached to a wing powered by rockets. Once safely seated, the vehicle stands vertically and takes off. Once in the air the plane detaches and shoots off into space on its suborbital journey - in the example to Dubai -before landing vertically on three legs which detract from its rear. Its ultrasonic speeds means passengers could travel between London and New York in around an hour. Ground tests by the company, full name Beijing Lingkong Tianxing Technology Co, are expected as early as next year, with a first flight in . A test flight for its space vehicle is expected as soon as .  A spokesman for the company said: What we are developing is a rocket with wings, which realises high-speed point-to-point transportation. “We are developing a winged rocket for high-speed, point-to-point transportation, which is lower in cost than rockets that carry satellites and faster than traditional aircraft.” A number of Test flights of the firm’s Tianxing  and Tianxing  vehicles have been held recently. Details on the prices people can expect for suborbital travel are currently unknown. Last year Sir Richard Branson’s Virgin Galactic passenger rocket plane soared more than  miles in its first fully crewed test flight to the edge of space. Touted as the precursor to a new era of space tourism, the company is said to be poised to begin commercial operations this year, with several hundred bookings already. Tickets cost around £, each. Sir Richard said last year: “Iaposve wanted to go to space since I was a kid, and I want to enable hopefully hundreds of thousands of other people over the next  years to be able to go to space. And why shouldnapost they go to space  Space is extraordinary the Universe is magnicent. “I want people to be able to look back at our beautul Earth and come home and work very hard to try to do magic to look after it. title: mystery 11 dolphins wash up
story: Mystery as  dolphins wash up dead on Costa del Sur tourist beaches in  monthExperts have been left scratching their heads as some speculate the dolphins could be getting confused from the sonar being used by submarines and others think it would be due to the recent inclement weather dolphins have washed up dead on multiple beaches on Costa del Sur in Spain Image: Twitter TrailAndaluciaByRita SobotAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Jan |comments Nearly a dozen dolphins have washed up on Costa del Sur beaches in just four weeks.Environmentalists have been left scratching their heads as they fear the protected animals may have been hit by a mystery virus or have even been affected by sonar rays from the increased number of warships in the area due to the crisis.So far this year,  dead dolphins have been found on the Spanish beaches of Malaga and there are fears more could wash up dead.Residents and tourists have been alerting the authorities after finding the succession of stranded animals lying on the sand.What could be the cause of this  Join the discussion in the comment section They have been washed up in the holiday hotspots of Estepona, Malaga, Torremolinos, Marbella and Nerja. One of the dolphins was a seven-year-old pregnant female. Dolphins usually live to be around . The most recent porpoise corpse was found on the beach of La Araña and had no obvious signs of injury or disease. The centre for the recovery of endangered marine speciesis hoping an autopsy can shed some light on the situation.  The tests that have already been carried out on other dead dolphins have not yet given conclusive results. Six years ago, a virus wreaked havoc among these marine mammals in other parts of the Mediterranean coast and in a previous wave around . Some experts fear that the increase of naval military manoeuvres in the face of the crisis in Ukraine and the sonar on these ships and submarines may be causing the dolphins to confuse their routes and end up on land. And other experts are pointing to the strong and persistent storms as the main cause of the mysterious tragedy. They say dolphins need to get their heads out of the water to breathe, andthey are exhausted or sick and use their mouth to breathe, then they may struggle to fight the waves and seek the shore to help them breathe, where most end up dying. Anyone finding a dolphin in distress is being urged not toit to the water but to immediately contact the authorities. title: new centre propels angus to forefront of farm innovation 2
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. title: exclusive nicky walker talks trading football for the famous family shortbread firm
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles. title: peterhead academy day life teacher school fun again
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles.
